The brands have 15 days to respond, which is likely to include a recall of products from Sephora, Ulta Beauty, Target, CVS, Revolve and Nordstrom shelves. Additionally, Sephora bets on another artist-founded color cosmetics line, P&G Beauty gets a new CEO, and OneSkin takes on $20 million in funding as biotech-powered beauty heats up.

But as the line between sports and the rest of culture increasingly blurs, jewelry brands are finding the massive audience of sports and NIL athletes too tempting to ignore.

title: The ‘hair longevity’ trend is set to drive sales and innovation this year
summary: What comes after the "skinification of haircare"? Glossy spoke to experts to better understand the hair longevity movement — which includes peptides, niacinamide, hyaluronic acid, collagen, probiotics and stem cells packed into clinical hair care — as well as the rapid expansion of the mass bond repair and scalp categories.

title: Plastic surgeon Dr. Thomas Sterry on Kylie Jenner’s boob job, the viral Guadalajara Facelift and plastic surgery’s image shift
summary: It's been a big couple of months for plastic surgery in the spotlight. The general public has always known that celebrities get plastic surgery — but 2025 has seemed to open a chamber of secrets when it comes to just what they're doing and who they're trusting to make these alterations to their bodies.
